content: A large supermarket chain wants to optimize its inventory management system. They currently stock 50,000 different products, with an average shelf life of 30 days. On average, they sell 1 million items per day across all their stores. To minimize waste and ensure product freshness, the company aims to maintain no more than a 5-day supply of perishable goods at any given time. Calculate the total amount of perishable goods that should be stored in their warehouses daily, providing step-by-step reasoning.

Now, the company wants to minimize waste and keep their perishable goods as fresh as possible. To do this, they've set a goal to maintain no more than a 5-day supply of perishable goods at any given time. So, I need to calculate the total amount of perishable goods that should be stored in their warehouses daily to meet this goal.
